## Create objects in R

1. R As Calculator
```{r}
3+5  
12/7  
12*7
3^2 # 3 to the power of 2

```

2. Assigning value to an object 
  - Word *object* and *variable* can differ in meaning, but here used synonymously. 
```{r}
# Creating objects
area_hectares <- 1.0 # asign

area_hectares # call
```

3. Discuss the naming rules and conventions
    - Characters, numbers, `_`, `.` allowed
    - Names cannot **start** with a number
    - Use of dots `.` not recommended
    - Some names not allowed (e.g. `if`, `else`)
    - Other allowed, but not recommended (e.g. `weights`, `df`, `mean`)
    - Case sensitive 
    - Stick to the same convention
    
4. Arithmetic with created objects
```{r}
# Arithmetic with objects

area_hectares * 2.47 

area_hectares <- 2.5  
area_hectares * 2.47  

area_acres <- area_hectares * 2.47 

area_hectares <- 50 
area_acres  

area_hectares * 2.47 

```

## Vectors and data types

1. Create vectors with `c()` (combine) function
```{r}
#Vectors 
hh_members <- c( 3, 7, 10, 6)
hh_members

respondent_wall_type <- c('muddaub', 'burntbricks', 'sunbricks')
respondent_wall_type
```

2. Inspect content of the vector
```{r}
#Length of vector
length(hh_members)
length(respondent_wall_type)

```

3. Add elements to a vector with `c()`
```{r}
# Adding elements to a vector
possessions <- c('bicycle', 'radio', 'television')
possessions <- c(possessions, 'mobile_phone') # add to the end of the vector
possessions <- c('car', possessions) # add to the beginning of the vector

possessions

```

4. Data types 
  - `numeric` (`double`)
  - `character`
  - `logical`
  - `integer`
  - `complex`
  - `raw`

7. Subsetting vectors 

```{r}
# Subsetting vectors
respondent_wall_type <- c('muddaub', 'burntbricks', 'sunbricks')

# Subsetting by index
respondent_wall_type[2] # 2 element of the vector
respondent_wall_type[c(3,2)] # 3 and 2 element of the vector

# Subsetting by logical vector
hh_members <- c(3, 7, 10, 6)
hh_members[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE)] # 1,3 and 4 element of the vector 

# Subsetting by condition

hh_members > 5   # condition creates a vector of logical values
hh_members[hh_members > 5]
hh_members[hh_members < 4 | hh_members > 7]
hh_members[hh_members >= 4 & hh_members <= 7]

possessions <- c("car", "bicycle", "radio", "television", "mobile_phone")

possessions[possessions == "car" | possessions == "bicycle"] 

possessions %in% c("car", "bicycle")
possessions[possessions %in% c("car", "bicycle")]


```

## Missing Data 
1. Missing data notation in R - NA
2. Use of `na.rm = TRUE` argument
```{r}
#Missing values

rooms <- c(2, 1, 1, NA, 7)
mean(rooms)
max(rooms)

mean(rooms, na.rm = TRUE)
max(rooms, na.rm = TRUE)
```

3. Useful functions: `is.na()`, `na.omit()`
```{r}
rooms
is.na(rooms)
!is.na(rooms)
rooms[!is.na(rooms)]

```
